items.title: the site
items.content: I created this website to help novice developers not only improve their skills, but also learn best practices in their tasks.

items.title: the Talks
items.content: I do a lot of 'Talks' in my old school, to motivate students, answer their questions (about the work of developer, freelance) and give them advice ..

items.title: teaching
items.content: I have taught a lot, especially teaching kids to code by creating games, building with tools like scratch, code.org & legos ev3 mindstorms.

items.title: helping
items.content: I like to help other developers (not just developers) to solve their problems because it allows me to learn more and more, which drives me to help more and more.

items.title: contests
items.content: I'm not a genius but I love to participate in online contests and hackathons, here are some references: hackerrank | codeforces | codechef.

items.title: Sports
items.content: My favorite sports are football, mind games (chess, sudoku), martial arts (kung fu and taekwondo). Unfortunately, the last has not been practiced for a long time ..

items.title: reading
items.content: Reading is one of my favorite moments; it is there that I feel like I am in the company of an expert (whatever the subject of the book). Here are some recommendations: The Art of Thinking Clearly | The Richest Man in Babylon | Goals! | Eat That Frog!.

items.title: Contribution
items.content: I like to contribute to projects / ideas that could solve a problem, help people, in other words, bring or lead to a change.

items.title: Online
items.content:
Apart from the training / tutorials, we can learn a lot of things just by watching a webinar (semiaire web) or a podcast, here are some links:
Podcasts: The PHP Roundtable | The freeCodeCamp Podcast | Modern Web | Tech Jr.
Conferences: WeAreDevelopers | Google Chrome Developers | JSConf | Docker Webnaires
